snippet: Xia Yeliang, dismissed from his job at Peking University after clashes with his government, warned that American universities should be careful about partnerships with Chinese universities.
abstract: Chinese dissident Xia Yeliang, dismissed from his job as economics professor at Peking University, will become a visiting fellow at the Cato Institute; Xia warns that American universities should be careful about partnerships with Chinese universities.
lead_paragraph: Xia Yeliang, dismissed from his job at Peking University after clashes with his government, warned that American universities should be careful about partnerships with Chinese universities.

headline.main: Chinese Dissident Lands at Cato Institute With a Caution to Colleges
headline.print_headline: Chinese Dissident Lands at Institute, With a Caution to Colleges
